alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Obion; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 7:18PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Gibson, Obion and Weakley. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 718 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Martin, Union City, Dresden, South Fulton, Dyer, Greenfield, Kenton, Rutherford, Bradford, Sharon, Rives, Sidonia, Kimery, Ralston, Mount Pelia, Gardner, Terrell, Hyndsver, Good Luck and McConnell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
